Author: jl777c#5810
Content: energizer bunny

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a lot of people want cartoons to make it easy to understand

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is the thing about marketing things, there is no deterministic answer with universal consensus

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means for any complicated thing being marketed, it is likely (pretty much guaranteed) that everyone wont be happy and maybe even nobody is totally happy with everything

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with continuous improvement, the key is to make sure progress is being made

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
>i stayed away from michelin and duracell indeed

üòÉ and still - regardless of that Michelin is the 2nd largest tyre company in the world not only famous for its tyres but also for the travel guides, roadmaps and last but not least the Michelin stars that they award to the best restaurants for their cooking. 
And Duracell is even marketleader in the battery industry and ahead of Energizer and other known brands. 

Like James pointed out - ppl do like cartoons and other forms of simplyfied and abstract marketing/PR. As always exceptions confirm the rule. Its very hard to find a marketing-path the everyone can identify with/is happy with.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont think there can even be consensus on what the right color is, leta alone all the marketing elements

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> Hello and Good Afternoon all. I am here to ask for help from you guys on the issue i am facing. I have been trying to Sync Chainzilla on Agama in Native mode. I am using the latest .41 beta version. At first it starts okay but get's stuck (looses all connections) at 47,xx%

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> have tried reindexing it, rescan, delete directory without or without wallet.dat and conf files.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> but somehow it stays and stuck everytime it reaches block "19758"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> Help would be really appreciated. here is a screenshot of the agama stuck at that point

Author: wil#2080
Content: Lite mode works also well for Chainzilla.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> well lite mode is okay but i am mostly a native guy hehe

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @Catalyst which operating system are you using? you could try replacing komodod/komodod.exe with one from https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/releases - [cc: @SHossain ]

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> I use windows 10

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> Can you guide how to use it? i am still a learner

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> Please, thank you. üôÇ

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
@Catalyst -the komodod.exe should be located in `C:\Program Files\AgamaApp\resources\app\assets\bin\win64\` it might be a slightly different path - check your username.. But before doing this its a good idea to backup your wallet.dat - **make sure to backup your wallet.dat in `C:\Users\Catalyst\AppData\Roaming\Komodo\ZILLA` before doing anything** - this applies to ALL wallet.dat files in `C:\Users\Catalyst\AppData\Roaming\Komodo\*` - and of course the Komodo wallet.dat itself as well. 


Afterwards before relaunching Agama plz delete the folder ZILLA in the AppData/Roaming path above (plzmake sure wallet.dat is backed up properly before doing so). Let us know how this goes for you.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: (ref. checking your username was related to the AppData/Roaming path and the Komodo datafolder in it)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <Catalyst> Thank you. i will try this right away
